verses.kjv: Thus saith the Lord GOD; The gate of the inner court that looketh toward the east shall be shut the six working days; but on the sabbath it shall be opened, and in the day of the new moon it shall be opened.
verses.ct: This is what the Lord GOD says: The east-facing gate of the inner court must stay closed during the 6 working days, but it will be opened on the Sabbath day and on the day of the new moon.

verses.kjv: And the prince shall enter by the way of the porch of that gate without, and shall stand by the post of the gate, and the priests shall prepare his burnt offering and his peace offerings, and he shall worship at the threshold of the gate: then he shall go forth; but the gate shall not be shut until the evening.
verses.ct: The prince will enter through the outer porch of that gate and stand beside the gatepost. The priests will prepare his burnt offering and his peace offerings, and he will worship at the threshold of the gate. Then he will leave, but the gate must not be closed until evening.

verses.kjv: Likewise the people of the land shall worship at the door of this gate before the LORD in the sabbaths and in the new moons.
verses.ct: In the same way, the common people will worship at the entrance of this gate in the LORD's presence on the Sabbaths and new moons.

verses.kjv: And the burnt offering that the prince shall offer unto the LORD in the sabbath day shall be six lambs without blemish, and a ram without blemish.
verses.ct: The burnt offering that the prince presents to the LORD on the Sabbath day will consist of 6 flawless lambs and 1 flawless ram.

verses.kjv: And the meat offering shall be an ephah for a ram, and the meat offering for the lambs as he shall be able to give, and an hin of oil to an ephah.
verses.ct: The grain offering will be an ephah of grain for the ram, and whatever he is able to give for the lambs, along with a hin of oil for each ephah.

verses.kjv: And in the day of the new moon it shall be a young bullock without blemish, and six lambs, and a ram: they shall be without blemish.
verses.ct: On the day of the new moon, the offering will be a flawless young bull, 6 lambs, and a ram — all without any defect.

verses.kjv: And he shall prepare a meat offering, an ephah for a bullock, and an ephah for a ram, and for the lambs according as his hand shall attain unto, and an hin of oil to an ephah.
verses.ct: He must provide a grain offering of an ephah for the bull, an ephah for the ram, and whatever he can afford for the lambs, plus a hin of oil for each ephah.

verses.kjv: And when the prince shall enter, he shall go in by the way of the porch of that gate, and he shall go forth by the way thereof.
verses.ct: When the prince enters, he must come in through the porch of that gate, and he must leave the same way.

verses.kjv: But when the people of the land shall come before the LORD in the solemn feasts, he that entereth in by the way of the north gate to worship shall go out by the way of the south gate; and he that entereth by the way of the south gate shall go forth by the way of the north gate: he shall not return by the way of the gate whereby he came in, but shall go forth over against it.
verses.ct: But when the common people come into the LORD's presence during the appointed festivals, anyone who enters through the north gate to worship must exit through the south gate, and anyone who enters through the south gate must exit through the north gate. No one should go back out through the same gate they came in — instead, they must leave through the opposite one.

verses.kjv: And the prince in the midst of them, when they go in, shall go in; and when they go forth, shall go forth.
verses.ct: The prince will go in among them when they enter and leave when they leave.

verses.kjv: And in the feasts and in the solemnities the meat offering shall be an ephah to a bullock, and an ephah to a ram, and to the lambs as he is able to give, and an hin of oil to an ephah.
verses.ct: At the festivals and appointed celebrations, the grain offering will be an ephah for each bull, an ephah for each ram, and whatever the giver can afford for the lambs, plus a hin of oil for each ephah.

verses.kjv: Now when the prince shall prepare a voluntary burnt offering or peace offerings voluntarily unto the LORD, one shall then open him the gate that looketh toward the east, and he shall prepare his burnt offering and his peace offerings, as he did on the sabbath day: then he shall go forth; and after his going forth one shall shut the gate.
verses.ct: Whenever the prince wants to present a voluntary burnt offering or voluntary peace offerings to the LORD, the east-facing gate will be opened for him. He will prepare his burnt offering and peace offerings just as he does on the Sabbath. After he leaves, the gate will be shut behind him.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt daily prepare a burnt offering unto the LORD of a lamb of the first year without blemish: thou shalt prepare it every morning.
verses.ct: You must prepare a daily burnt offering to the LORD — a 1-year-old lamb without any defect. You must prepare it every morning.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt prepare a meat offering for it every morning, the sixth part of an ephah, and the third part of an hin of oil, to temper with the fine flour; a meat offering continually by a perpetual ordinance unto the LORD.
verses.ct: Along with it, you must prepare a grain offering every morning: 1/6 of an ephah of fine flour mixed with 1/3 of a hin of oil. This is a permanent grain offering to the LORD, required by a lasting regulation.

verses.kjv: Thus shall they prepare the lamb, and the meat offering, and the oil, every morning for a continual burnt offering.
verses.ct: So the lamb, the grain offering, and the oil must be prepared every morning as a regular burnt offering.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the Lord GOD; If the prince give a gift unto any of his sons, the inheritance thereof shall be his sons’; it shall be their possession by inheritance.
verses.ct: This is what the Lord GOD says: If the prince gives a gift of land to any of his sons, it belongs to them as their inherited property.

verses.kjv: But if he give a gift of his inheritance to one of his servants, then it shall be his to the year of liberty; after it shall return to the prince: but his inheritance shall be his sons’ for them.
verses.ct: However, if he gives a gift from his property to one of his servants, it will belong to that servant only until the year of release, when it reverts back to the prince. Only gifts to his sons become permanent inherited property.

verses.kjv: Moreover the prince shall not take of the people’s inheritance by oppression, to thrust them out of their possession; but he shall give his sons inheritance out of his own possession: that my people be not scattered every man from his possession.
verses.ct: Furthermore, the prince must never seize property from the people by force, driving them off their land. He must provide his sons' inheritance only from his own property, so that none of my people are displaced from what belongs to them.

verses.kjv: After he brought me through the entry, which was at the side of the gate, into the holy chambers of the priests, which looked toward the north: and, behold, there was a place on the two sides westward.
verses.ct: Then he brought me through the entrance beside the gate into the sacred rooms belonging to the priests, which faced north. I noticed a space at the far western end on both sides.

verses.kjv: Then said he unto me, This is the place where the priests shall boil the trespass offering and the sin offering, where they shall bake the meat offering; that they bear them not out into the utter court, to sanctify the people.
verses.ct: He told me, "This is the area where the priests will cook the guilt offering and the sin offering, and where they will bake the grain offering. This way they won't need to carry these offerings out into the outer court, where contact with the people would make them holy."

verses.kjv: Then he brought me forth into the utter court, and caused me to pass by the four corners of the court; and, behold, in every corner of the court there was a court.
verses.ct: Then he brought me out into the outer court and led me past each of its 4 corners. In every corner of the court, there was an enclosed courtyard.

verses.kjv: In the four corners of the court there were courts joined of forty cubits long and thirty broad: these four corners were of one measure.
verses.ct: In all 4 corners of the court were enclosed courtyards, each 40 cubits long and 30 cubits wide. All 4 were the same size.

verses.kjv: And there was a row of building round about in them, round about them four, and it was made with boiling places under the rows round about.
verses.ct: Around the inside of each one was a stone ledge, with cooking hearths built underneath the ledges on every side.

verses.kjv: Then said he unto me, These are the places of them that boil, where the ministers of the house shall boil the sacrifice of the people.
verses.ct: He told me, "These are the kitchens where the temple servants will cook the sacrifices that the people bring."
